CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert Jackson, 502 Kirkpatrick Street, retired, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think common-law marriage should be outlawed?" answer reads: "I believe in God and therefore I don't think that anyone is married until the marriage is by God for the sake of his fellowman [sic], which means going and getting a marriage license. For any man to live with a woman for six months and call her his wife is not good.  In fact, it is a sin in the sight of God.  And something has to happen to such a situation.  In my opinion, this is the reason why a lot of women are doing the men bad today."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert Jackson, wearing textured button down coat with collar and lapels, patterned necktie, and dark hat, standing with hands in pockets in front of brick building with two windows with match stick blinds
